A condition in which symptoms of a concussion persist for weeks, months, or even years after the initial injury. 
Common symptoms: history of recent head trauma, persistent headaches, nausea, vomiting, fatigue, difficulty sleeping, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, irritability, loss of coordination, slurred speech, dilated pupils, problems with vision. 
Not common symptoms: seizures, loss of consciousness, confusion, restlessness, agitation, noticeable weakness or numbness on one side of the body.

A type of injury that occurs when the brain is damaged as a result of external force, such as a blow to the head or a penetrating head injury. 
Common symptoms: history of recent head trauma, persistent headaches, nausea, vomiting, fatigue, difficulty sleeping, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, irritability, loss of coordination, slurred speech, dilated pupils, problems with vision, seizures, loss of consciousness, confusion, restlessness, agitation, noticeable weakness or numbness on one side of the body.

\n\n+4. Stroke: 
A medical condition that occurs when the blood supply to the brain is interrupted, either due to a blockage or a rupture of the blood vessels. 
Common symptoms: loss of coordination, slurred speech, dilated pupils, problems with vision, noticeable weakness or numbness on one side of the body. 
Not common symptoms: history of recent head trauma, persistent headaches, nausea, vomiting, fatigue, difficulty sleeping, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, irritability, seizures, loss of consciousness, confusion, restlessness, agitation.

Not common symptoms: history of recent head trauma, persistent headaches, nausea, vomiting, fatigue, difficulty sleeping, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, irritability, loss of coordination, slurred speech, dilated pupils, problems with vision.

Not common symptoms: history of recent head trauma, persistent headaches, nausea, vomiting, fatigue, difficulty sleeping, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, irritability, loss of coordination, slurred speech, dilated pupils, problems with vision.
